item.title: Fallacies Of Distributed Computing
item.description: :ID: 5a3ae2dc-5a54-4ba1-a638-f6090502d8ae Between 1991 and 1997, engineers at Sun Microsystems collected a list of mistakes that programmers commonly make when writing software for networked computers. Bill Joy, Dave Lyon, L Peter Deutsch, and James Gosling cataloged eight assumptions that developers commonly hold about Distributed Systems. These assumptions, while obviously incorrect when stated explicitly, nevertheless inform many of the decisions that the Sun engineers found in systems of the day. (Perry 2020, 6)
